New Records: Oman recorded their lowest completed total in T20Is, being bowled out for 47.
This was the lowest total England has ever inflicted on an opponent in a T20I.
Key Match Events: Adil Rashid claimed four wickets, including three tail-enders.
Mark Wood took three wickets, dismissing three of the top six batsmen.
England chased down the target with 101 balls to spare.
Jos Buttler scored 24 not out off 8 balls.
Jonny Bairstow scored 8 not out off 2 balls.
Pre-Game Insights: England had a point to prove after their previous performances.
England decided to bowl first after winning the toss.
Post-Match Reflections: Jos Buttler praised the bowlers for their performance, highlighting the extra bounce and good line and length.
Mark Wood mentioned that the team had a point to prove and described the pitch as having extra bounce.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The weather forecast for England's next game against Namibia suggests a 40-50% chance of rain.
England's net run rate improved significantly from -1.80 to +3.08 after this match.
